sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

sentences.english: advanced learners of English
sentences.chinese: 高级程度的英语学习者

sentences.english: advanced physics
sentences.chinese: 高等物理（学）

detailed_translations.english: studying or dealing with a school subject at a difficult level

sentences.english: Our agent in Rio deals with all our Brazilian business.
sentences.chinese: 我们在里约热内卢的业务代表处理我们在巴西的全部业务。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

sentences.english: I’m not joking. Those were his actual words.
sentences.chinese: 我没开玩笑，那都是他的原话。

sentences.english: I know Germany won, but I can’t tell you the actual score.
sentences.chinese: 我知道德国队胜了，但我不知道确切的比分。

sentences.english: Interest is only charged on the actual amount borrowed.
sentences.chinese: 利息只按实际借款额收取。

sentences.english: In actual fact (= really  ) , there is little evidence to support the allegations.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些指控几乎没有证据支持。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: ambiguous
trans: adj. 模棱两可的，含糊不清的

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: alternative
trans: n. 替代物；adj. 可替代的

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

sentences.english: They phrase in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 他们逐步采用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: This factory has phased in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂已开始逐渐使用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: Then you could have your test automation read, parse, and use the data in this file.
sentences.chinese: 然后您可以让您的测试自动化读取、解析和使用该文件中的数据。

detailed_translations.english: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar
sentences.chinese: 特拉法尔加战役

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

sentences.english: capital investments
sentences.chinese: 资本投资

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

sentences.english: I dread to think what the carbon footprint must be like of moving that coal but we have no choice.
sentences.chinese: 我都不敢想象为了运这些煤产生了多少碳足迹，但我们没有选择。

sentences.english: By removing whales, sharks and large fish, we ve reduced the amount of carbon stored in these populations.
sentences.chinese: 由于猎杀鲸鱼，鲨鱼和大型鱼类，我们也就减少了碳在这些物种群的储存量。

sentences.english: Across the world, forests and the soil beneath them absorb about a quarter of all carbon emissions.
sentences.chinese: 纵观全球，森林与它们脚下的土壤能吸收大约碳排放总量的四分之一。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that exists in a pure form as diamonds,  graphite  etc, or in an impure form as coal, petrol etc. It is a chemical  element  : symbol C

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

sentences.english: The morning paper carried a story about demonstrations in New York and Washington D.C.
sentences.chinese: 晨报登载了纽约和华盛顿特区举行示威游行的报道。

sentences.english: The national TV network carries religious programmes.
sentences.chinese: 全国电视网播出宗教节目。

detailed_translations.english: if a newspaper, a television or radio broadcast, or a website carries a piece of news, an advertisement etc, it prints it or broadcasts it

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

sentences.english: It’s Dad’s birthday and we’re going out for a meal to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.english: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.english: poems that celebrate the joys of love
sentences.chinese: 赞美爱之喜悦的诗歌

detailed_translations.english: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

sentences.english: Interest rates fell by six percentage points (= 6% ) .
sentences.chinese: 利息下降了6个百分点。

sentences.english: The numbers are small in percentage terms (= when calculated as a percentage ) .
sentences.chinese: 按百分比来看，这些数字很小。

detailed_translations.english: an amount expressed as if it is part of a total which is 100

sentences.english: lines radiating out from the centre
sentences.chinese: 从中心向外辐射的线条

sentences.english: chocolates with soft centres
sentences.chinese: 软夹心巧克力

sentences.english: The title isn’t quite centred on the page, is it?
sentences.chinese: 标题并不在这页的正中间，是吗？

detailed_translations.english: the middle of a space, area, or object, especially the exact middle
to move something to a position at the centre of something else

sentences.english: He lives in central London.
sentences.chinese: 他住在伦敦市中心。

sentences.english: The roof is supported by a central column.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶由一根中心柱支撑着。

sentences.english: Owen played a central role in the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 欧文在谈判中担任了重要角色。

detailed_translations.english: in the middle of an area or an object

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

sentences.english: I felt certain that I’d passed the test.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉自己肯定通过这次测验了。

sentences.english: Many people look certain to lose their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 许多人看来肯定要失业了。

detailed_translations.english: confident and sure, without any doubts

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

sentences.english: the economic recession of the early 1980s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

sentences.english: a chart showing last year’s sales
sentences.chinese: 显示去年销售情况的一份图表

sentences.english: a weather chart
sentences.chinese: 天气图

sentences.english: the theatre’s seating chart
sentences.chinese: 剧场的座位图

detailed_translations.english: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures,  graph  etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it

detailed_translations.chinese: 用图表表示， 在图上表示
detailed_translations.english: if a record charts, it enters the weekly list of the most popular records

name: chemical
trans: adj. 化学的；n. 化学制品

sentences.english: the chemical composition of bleach
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂的化学成分

sentences.english: a chemical analysis of the soil
sentences.chinese: 对土壤的化学分析

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances
relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances

sentences.english: Ken had an accident at work and had to go to hospital.
sentences.chinese: 肯在工作中出了事故，不得不去医院。

sentences.english: I had a slight accident with your coffee.
sentences.chinese: 出了个小小的意外，我把你的咖啡弄洒了。

sentences.english: a train accident
sentences.chinese: 火车事故

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone is injured or something is damaged without anyone intending them to be

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

sentences.english: More people commit suicide at Christmas than at any other time.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间自杀的人比其他任何时候都多。

sentences.english: My mother attempted suicide on many occasions.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲多次试图自杀。

sentences.english: He apparently left a suicide note (= letter explaining his reasons for killing himself ) on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他显然在桌上留了封绝笔信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of killing yourself

sentences.english: the council for civil liberties
sentences.chinese: 公民自由委员会

sentences.english: the UN Security Council
sentences.chinese: 联合国安全理事会

detailed_translations.english: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

sentences.english: We need our schools to teach students to be good citizens.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要学校把学生培养为好公民。

sentences.english: The mayor urged citizens to begin preparing for a major storm.
sentences.chinese: 一场特大暴风雨即将到来，市长敦促市民做好准备。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a particular town, country, or state

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

sentences.english: a meeting with an important client
sentences.chinese: 与一位重要客户的会面

detailed_translations.english: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

sentences.english: He works for a large American corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他在一家美国大公司工作。

sentences.english: multinational corporations
sentences.chinese: 跨国公司

sentences.english: the Siemens Corporation
sentences.chinese: 西门子公司

detailed_translations.english: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

sentences.english: This job is so boring. I wish I could do something more creative.
sentences.chinese: 这工作太单调了，我希望能做些更有创造性的事情。

sentences.english: I teach creative writing at Trinity College.
sentences.chinese: 我在三一学院教创意写作。

sentences.english: the creative process of writing a poem
sentences.chinese: 写诗的创作过程

sentences.english: Diaghilev did his great creative work in France.
sentences.chinese: 狄亚格列夫在法国编创了富有创新性的伟大作品。

sentences.english: a creative solution to the problem
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的创新性解决方法

detailed_translations.english: involving the use of imagination to produce new ideas or things

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

sentences.english: Experts cannot agree on the causes of criminal behaviour .
sentences.chinese: 专家对犯罪行为的原因不能取得一致意见。

sentences.english: I was sure he was involved in some kind of criminal activity .
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他在从事某种犯罪活动。

sentences.english: She has not committed a criminal offence (= a crime ) .
sentences.chinese: 她没有犯罪。

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with criminal damage (= damaging someone’s property illegally ) .
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控犯有刑事损坏罪。

sentences.english: The doctor was found guilty of criminal negligence (= not taking enough care to protect people you are responsible for ) .
sentences.chinese: 这名医生被判过失犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: relating to crime
someone who is involved in illegal activities or has been proved guilty of a crime

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

sentences.english: a crude wooden bridge
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的木桥

sentences.english: crude oil/metal
sentences.chinese: 原油；未经提炼的金属

detailed_translations.english: not developed to a high standard, or made with little skill

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

sentences.english: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

sentences.english: The new treatment effected a miraculous cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种新疗法产生了奇迹般的疗效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
the act of making someone well again after an illness

sentences.english: The trial was held under tight security .
sentences.chinese: 这场审讯是在戒备森严的情况下进行的。

sentences.english: lax security at airline check-in desks
sentences.chinese: 登机手续柜台松懈的安全措施

sentences.english: terrorist activity that is a threat to national security
sentences.chinese: 威胁国家安全的恐怖活动

sentences.english: The prison was ordered to tighten security after a prisoner escaped yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天一名囚犯越狱后，该监狱被勒令加强安全措施。

sentences.english: The Security Commission investigates breaches of security .
sentences.chinese: 安全委员会对违反安全规定的事项进行调查。

sentences.english: We have been asked not to say anything for security reasons .
sentences.chinese: 出于安全考虑，我们被要求守口如瓶。

sentences.english: The security forces opened fire, killing two people.
sentences.chinese: 保安部队开枪打死了两个人。

sentences.english: The thief was caught on a security camera .
sentences.chinese: 小偷被保安摄像机当场拍了下来。

sentences.english: There are strict security checks on everyone entering the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 每个人进入歌剧院都要接受严格的安全检查。

sentences.english: A large number of homes lack adequate security measures .
sentences.chinese: 许多住宅都未采取足够的安全措施。

detailed_translations.english: things that are done to keep a person, building, or country safe from danger or crime

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: current
trans: adj. 当前的；n. 流，趋势

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

sentences.english: Remove the cores, and bake the apples for 40 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 去除果心，然后把苹果烤40分钟。

sentences.english: Debt is at the core of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 债务是问题的关键。

detailed_translations.english: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

sentences.english: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
sentences.chinese: 她在海关被叫住接受问话。

sentences.english: It took ages to clear customs (= be allowed through customs ) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
sentences.chinese: 过海关花了很长时间，不过出机场倒是很快。

sentences.english: You won’t be able to take that through customs.
sentences.chinese: 你带着那东西过不了海关的。

detailed_translations.english: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

name: cycle
trans: n. 周期，循环；v. 骑自行车

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

sentences.english: He had enough money to pay off his outstanding debts.
sentences.chinese: 他有足够的钱偿还亏欠的债务。

sentences.english: students who run up huge debts
sentences.chinese: 欠下巨额债务的学生

detailed_translations.english: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

sentences.english: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: …19世纪的最后10年。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 10 years

name: damage
trans: n. 损害，损失；v. 损坏，破坏

sentences.english: insects that damage crops
sentences.chinese: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

sentences.english: There may be permanent brain damage.
sentences.chinese: 可能有永久性脑损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

sentences.english: a democratic government
sentences.chinese: 民主政府

sentences.english: the role of the media in the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 民主进程中媒体的作用

detailed_translations.english: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country

sentences.english: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule

trans: adj. 个人的，个别的；n. 个人，个体

sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.chinese: 为保卫祖国而献身的战士

sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.chinese: 确定客户需求的能力

sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: historical fiction

sentences.chinese: 多年来他设法一直给人一种未婚的假象。

sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

sentences.chinese: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

detailed_translations.english: being the same in all its parts or among all its members
a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

name: comfort
trans: n. 舒适，安慰；v. 安慰

sentences.english: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我穿衣服只讲舒服，不追求时髦。

sentences.english: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦很不情愿离开暖和舒适的火堆。

sentences.english: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
sentences.chinese: 现在你可以舒舒服服地在自己家里看你最喜欢的电影了。

sentences.english: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
sentences.chinese: 他每当心烦意乱时，就会去向她寻求安慰和建议。

sentences.english: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们来的时候你出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true

sentences.english: Trains rushed past at frequent intervals .
sentences.chinese: 火车频频驶过。

sentences.english: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她是家里的常客。

detailed_translations.english: happening or doing something often
to go to a particular place often

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

sentences.english: genetic defects
sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

detailed_translations.english: relating to genes or genetics

name: general
trans: adj. 普遍的，普通的；n. 将军

sentences.english: There has been a general decline in standards.
sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.english: ways to improve your general health
sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.english: There is one exception to this general principle.
sentences.chinese: 这个一般性原则有一例外

sentences.english: a four-star general
sentences.chinese: 四星上将

detailed_translations.english: affecting all or most people, places or things
an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

sentences.english: Like most of my generation, I had never known a war.
sentences.chinese: 和我们这一代的大多数人一样，我并没有经历过战争。

sentences.english: In my generation the divorce rate is very high.
sentences.chinese: 我们这一代人离婚率很高。

sentences.english: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.chinese: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.english: The story has been handed down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事是一代一代传下来的。

sentences.english: the generation of electricity
sentences.chinese: 发电

detailed_translations.english: all people of about the same age

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

sentences.english: the leaders who govern the country
sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.english: The party had been governing for seven months.
sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

sentences.english: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙受到物理法则的支配。

detailed_translations.english: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc

sentences.english: The Government are planning further cuts in public spending.
sentences.chinese: 政府正计划进一步削减公共支出。

sentences.english: The US government has tightened restrictions on firearms.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府已经加强了对枪支的管制。

sentences.english: Neither party had the majority necessary to form a government.
sentences.chinese: 两个政党都没有获得组阁所必需的多数票。

sentences.english: strong government
sentences.chinese: 强有力的统治

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who govern a country or state

sentences.english: There has been a gradual change in climate.
sentences.chinese: 气候渐渐发生了变化。

sentences.english: the gradual decline in manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 制造业的逐渐衰退

sentences.english: Education is a gradual process.
sentences.chinese: 教育是一个循序渐进的过程。

detailed_translations.english: happening slowly over a long period of time

name: progress
trans: n. 进步，进展；v. 进展，发展

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

sentences.english: a congress of the ruling Labor Party
sentences.chinese: 执政党工党的代表大会

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting of representatives of different groups, countries etc, to discuss ideas, make decisions etc

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: exhibit
trans: v. 展示，展览；n. 展品

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

sentences.english: All visitors to the exhibition must report to the main service desk.
sentences.chinese: 到展览会参观的人都必须先到总服务台报到。

sentences.english: Our country will tie up with another country to host this exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我国将和另外一个国家联合主办这次展览会。

sentences.english: You go to the exhibition centre, I must hie myself to tell the new matters.
sentences.chinese: 你去展览中心吧，我得赶紧汇报一下这个新情况。

detailed_translations.english: a show of paintings, photographs, or other objects that people can go to see

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

sentences.english: places of historical interest
sentences.chinese: 历史名胜

sentences.english: It is important to look at the novel in its historical context .
sentences.chinese: 在历史背景下看待这部小说很重要。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the past

sentences.english: I am a historian, and I teach in an American university.
sentences.chinese: 我是一位历史学家，在美国一所大学任教。

sentences.english: "There’s nothing I can tell you about how [this or] any other incidents were or are handled, " CIA historian David Robarge said.
sentences.chinese: “关于[这一或]或任何其他事故是如何处理的，我没有什么可以告诉你的，”中央情报局历史学家大卫·罗巴尔说。

sentences.english: The historian drew a horizontal line on the date to remember it.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家在日期上画了一条水平线来记住这天。

detailed_translations.english: A historian is a person who specializes in the study of history, and who writes books and articles about it

sentences.english: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

sentences.english: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s identity is their name or who they are

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

name: intellectual
trans: adj. 智力的，理智的；n. 知识分子

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: interior
trans: n. 内部，内陆；adj. 内部的，国内的

sentences.english: The interior walls are all painted white.
sentences.chinese: 室内墙壁都粉刷成了白色。

sentences.english: The interior of the church was dark.
sentences.chinese: 教堂里很暗。

detailed_translations.english: inside or indoors
the inner part or inside of something

name: initial
trans: adj. 最初的，初始的；n. 首字母

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: objective
trans: n. 目标，目的；adj. 客观的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

sentences.english: a well-known journalist and broadcaster
sentences.chinese: 一位著名的新闻记者兼播音员

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

sentences.english: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

name: justify
trans: v. 证明…是正当的，辩解

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

sentences.english: He trusted in his judgement.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他的判断。

sentences.english: All action is based on judgement.
sentences.chinese: 一切行动均以判断为基础。

sentences.english: The judgement is often biased by interest.
sentences.chinese: 判断往往因利害关系而有偏差。

name: prejudice
trans: n. 偏见，成见；v. 使有偏见

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

detailed_translations.english: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

name: collapse
trans: v. 崩溃，倒塌；n. 崩溃

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

sentences.english: The party was small and select.
sentences.chinese: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.english: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.chinese: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
detailed_translations.english: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

sentences.english: The judges have made their final selection.
sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: collective
trans: adj. 集体的，共同的；n. 集体

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: lecture
trans: n. 讲座，演讲；v. 演讲，授课

sentences.english: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
sentences.chinese: 他经常讲授法国现代文学课程。

sentences.english: He lectures on European art at Manchester University.
sentences.chinese: 他在曼彻斯特大学讲授欧洲艺术。

detailed_translations.english: a long talk on a particular subject that someone gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university
to talk to a group of people on a particular subject, especially to students in a university

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.

sentences.english: ...the Renaissance masterpieces in London's galleries.
sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.english: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: notice
trans: n. 通知，注意；v. 注意到

sentences.english: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.chinese: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.english: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.english: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.english: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.chinese: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.english: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

detailed_translations.english: if you notice something or someone, you realize that they exist, especially because you can see, hear, or feel them
when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

sentences.english: France’s reliance on nuclear energy
sentences.chinese: 法国对核能的依赖

sentences.english: a nuclear power station
sentences.chinese: 核电站

sentences.english: a nuclear-powered submarine
sentences.chinese: 核动力潜艇

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the nucleus of an atom, or the energy produced when the nucleus of an atom is either split or joined with the nucleus of another atom

name: obscure
trans: adj. 模糊的，晦涩的；v. 使模糊，掩盖

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

sentences.english: The whole operation is performed in less than three seconds.
sentences.chinese: 全部运算在三秒内完成。

detailed_translations.english: an action done by a computer

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: impact
trans: n. 影响，冲击；v. 影响

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

name: support
trans: v. 支持，支撑；n. 支持

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: import
trans: n. 进口，意义；v. 进口

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

name: transport
trans: v. 运输，运送；n. 运输

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: patient
trans: n. 病人；adj. 有耐心的

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

sentences.english: The issue arouses strong passions.
sentences.chinese: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

sentences.english: Gardening was her great passion.
sentences.chinese: 她酷爱园艺。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的情感，激情；强烈的爱好，热爱
detailed_translations.english: a very strong belief or feeling about something

name: appeal
trans: v. 呼吁，吸引；n. 吸引力

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: separate
trans: v. 分开，隔离；adj. 分开的

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。
