detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

sentences.english: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 新技术问世后，这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

sentences.english: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近他有点怪异。

sentences.english: She’s a very peculiar child.
sentences.chinese: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: indispensable
trans: adj. 不可缺少的，必需的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

sentences.english: a colour photograph
sentences.chinese: 彩色照片

sentences.english: a black and white photograph
sentences.chinese: 黑白照片

sentences.english: Tim was looking through an old photograph album (= book in which you put photographs ) .
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆在翻看一本旧相册。

sentences.english: Did you see Leo’s photograph (= a photograph of Leo ) in the newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你看到报纸上利奥的照片了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a picture obtained by using a camera and film that is sensitive to light
to take a photograph of someone or something

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

sentences.english: The picture shows six of the nine planets in the solar system.
sentences.chinese: 这张图片展示太阳系9个行星中的6个行星。

detailed_translations.english: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.

sentences.english: She told the court she would give a full explanation of the prosecution's decision on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉法庭她将在星期一就控方的决定做出详尽的解释。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why sth happened; a reason given for sth

name: plant
trans: n. 植物，工厂；v. 种植

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

name: plastic
trans: n. 塑料；adj. 塑料制的

sentences.english: a plastic spoon
sentences.chinese: 塑料汤匙

sentences.english: plastic bags
sentences.chinese: 塑料袋

detailed_translations.english: made of plastic

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

name: pleasant
trans: adj. 令人愉快的，舒适的

sentences.english: It had been a pleasant evening.
sentences.chinese: 那是个愉快的夜晚。

sentences.english: the pleasant climate of Southern California
sentences.chinese: 南加利福尼亚的宜人气候

sentences.english: The restaurant was large and pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅宽敞舒适。

sentences.english: Kate! What a pleasant surprise !
sentences.chinese: 凯特！真是让人惊喜！

detailed_translations.english: enjoyable or attractive and making you feel happy

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately causing sth to explode

sentences.english: She was offered employment in the sales office.
sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用
detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

name: complex
trans: adj. 复杂的；n. 综合体

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

sentences.english: We receive hundreds of job applications each year.
sentences.chinese: 我们每年收到数百封求职信。

sentences.english: I filled in the application form and sent it off.
sentences.chinese: 我填完申请表后把它寄了出去。

sentences.english: You have to submit your application before the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 月底之前必须递交申请。

sentences.english: I’ve put in an application for a transfer.
sentences.chinese: 我已递交了调动申请。

sentences.english: He received a letter saying that his application had been rejected .
sentences.chinese: 他收到一封信，告知他的申请已被拒绝。

sentences.english: It can take a long time for your visa application to be processed .
sentences.chinese: 办理签证申请可能需要很长时间。

sentences.english: The Council is currently reviewing the way it deals with planning applications .
sentences.chinese: 市政会目前正在审查其处理规划申请的方式。

sentences.english: Thank you for your letter of application , which we received yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 你的申请信昨天收悉，谢谢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 申请， 申请书； 施用， 涂抹； 应用， 实施； 实用性
detailed_translations.english: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

sentences.english: Some minerals have complex chemical compositions.
sentences.chinese: 有些矿物的化学构成很复杂。

sentences.english: a composition by jazzman Dave Brubeck, called ‘Chromatic Fantasy’
sentences.chinese: 爵士音乐家戴夫•布鲁贝克的作品《半音阶幻想曲》

sentences.english: The Journals contain accounts of literary composition.
sentences.chinese: 《期刊》中有关于文学创作的报道。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: opposite
trans: adj. 相反的，对立的；n. 对立面

sentences.english: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这药会让他睡觉，但是它却起了反作用。

sentences.english: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
sentences.chinese: 截然相反的是，阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。

sentences.english: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。

detailed_translations.english: as different as possible from something else
a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

name: potential
trans: adj. 潜在的；n. 潜力，可能性

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: praise
trans: v. 赞扬，称赞；n. 赞美

sentences.english: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.english: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.english: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.chinese: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.english: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.chinese: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.english: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.english: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：简受到了老师的表扬。

detailed_translations.english: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

detailed_translations.english: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

sentences.english: each individual’s right to privacy
sentences.chinese: 每个人的隐私权

detailed_translations.english: the state of being free from public attention

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: approach
trans: v. 接近，靠近；n. 方法，途径

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

sentences.english: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

sentences.english: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这本指南正被翻译成好几种语言，准备在圣诞节前后出版。

sentences.english: a delay in the publication of the exam results
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩的延期公布

detailed_translations.english: the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published

name: republican
trans: adj. 共和的，共和党人的

sentences.english: Lower taxes made Republican voters happier with their party.
sentences.chinese: 更低的税率使共和党选民对该党更加满意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 共和国的；共和政体的；共和主义的；拥护共和政体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or supporting a system of government that is not led by a king or queen
someone who believes in government by elected representatives only, with no king or queen

sentences.english: rings made of pure gold
sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.english: Our beef patties are 100% pure.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.english: His motives were pure.
sentences.chinese: 他动机纯正。

detailed_translations.english: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

sentences.english: It’s about a page and a quarter.
sentences.chinese: 大概是一又四分之一页。

sentences.english: Cut the cake into quarters.
sentences.chinese: 把蛋糕切成四等份。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in a quarter of an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我们一刻钟之后见。

detailed_translations.english: one of four equal parts into which something can be divided

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

name: request
trans: n. 请求，要求；v. 请求，要求

sentences.english: They have made an urgent request for international aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.english: To request more information, please call our toll free number.
sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

detailed_translations.english: a polite or formal demand for something
to ask for something in a polite or formal way

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: radical
trans: adj. 根本的，激进的；n. 激进分子

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: range
trans: n. 范围，幅度；v. 涉及

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

sentences.english: There seem to be so many rules and regulations these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像条条框框很多。

sentences.english: regulations governing the safety of toys
sentences.chinese: 监控玩具安全的条例

sentences.english: All companies must comply with the regulations .
sentences.chinese: 所有公司都必须遵守规定。

detailed_translations.english: an official rule or order

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: ritual
trans: n. 仪式，惯例；adj. 仪式的

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

sentences.english: Others here are more sceptical about the chances for justice being done.
sentences.chinese: 这里的其他人更为怀疑正义能否得到伸张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: If you are sceptical about something, you have doubts about it

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

sentences.english: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。

sentences.english: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
sentences.chinese: 从你的描述来看，柏林是个迷人的城市。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: senior
trans: adj. 资深的，年长的；n. 年长者

sentences.english: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
sentences.chinese: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

detailed_translations.english: a  senior citizen

name: present
trans: adj. 现在的，出席的；n. 礼物；v. 提出

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: representative
trans: n. 代表，代理人；adj. 代表的

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

sentences.english: Most computer users have never received any formal keyboard training. Consequently, their keyboard skills are inefficient.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的电脑使用者都没有经过正规的键盘操作训练，因此他们的键盘技巧不够熟练。

sentences.english: The molecules are absorbed into the bloodstream and consequently affect the organs.
sentences.chinese: 这些分子被吸收到血液里，从而影响到器官。

detailed_translations.english: as a result

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

sentences.english: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

detailed_translations.english: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

name: conservative
trans: adj. 保守的，守旧的；n. 保守派

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: reserve
trans: v. 保留，预订；n. 储备

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: design
trans: v. 设计，构思；n. 设计

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

sentences.english: a decision of major political significance
sentences.chinese: 具有重大政治意义的决定

detailed_translations.english: the importance of sth, especially when this has an effect on what happens in the future

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: associate
trans: v. 联想，关联；n. 同事

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

sentences.english: The best solution would be for them to separate.
sentences.chinese: 最好的解决方法是他们分开。

sentences.english: he solution of glucose in water
sentences.chinese: 葡萄糖在水中的溶解

detailed_translations.english: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: prospect
trans: n. 前景，展望；v. 勘探

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: suspect
trans: v. 怀疑，猜想；n. 嫌疑犯

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

sentences.english: games suitable for specific age groups
sentences.chinese: 适合特定年龄组的游戏

sentences.english: a specific example of alcohol’s effect on the body
sentences.chinese: 酒精对身体影响的具体例子

detailed_translations.english: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group
particular details

sentences.english: a heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 心脏专科医生

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

name: desperate
trans: adj. 绝望的，极度渴望的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

name: sponsor
trans: n. 赞助者，发起者；v. 赞助

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

sentences.english: Spouses were invited to the company picnic.
sentences.chinese: 配偶受到邀请参加公司的野餐会。

detailed_translations.english: a husband or wife

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

sentences.english: Measure the distance between the two points.
sentences.chinese: 量出两点之间的距离。

sentences.english: The cottage is some distance (= quite a long distance ) from the road.
sentences.chinese: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

sentences.english: Church bells rang in the distance (= they were far away ) .
sentences.chinese: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space between two places or things

name: stable
trans: adj. 稳定的，牢固的；n. 马厩

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

sentences.english: I want to get off at the next station.
sentences.chinese: 我要在下一站下车。

sentences.english: Grand Central Station
sentences.chinese: 中央火车站

sentences.english: Is there a waiting room in the station?
sentences.chinese: 车站里有候车室吗？

sentences.english: the city bus station
sentences.chinese: 市内公共汽车站

detailed_translations.english: a place where trains or buses regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off, goods can be loaded etc, or the buildings at such a place
to send someone in the military to a particular place for a period of time as part of their military duty

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

name: contrast
trans: n. 对比，差异；v. 对比

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

sentences.english: The right to speak freely is written into the Constitution of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由的权利被写入美国宪法。

sentences.english: She’s got a strong constitution – she’ll recover in no time.
sentences.chinese: 她体质强壮，很快就会恢复。

sentences.english: What’s the chemical constitution of the dye?
sentences.chinese: 这种染料的化学成分是什么？

detailed_translations.english: a set of basic laws and principles that a country or organization is governed by

name: institute
trans: n. 学院，研究所；v. 建立

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

sentences.english: the storage of highly radioactive material
sentences.chinese: 高放射性材料的存放

sentences.english: storage costs
sentences.chinese: 保管费用

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: strain
trans: n. 压力，紧张；v. 拉紧

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: attack
trans: v. 攻击，抨击；n. 攻击

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: contact
trans: n. 接触，联系；v. 联系

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

sentences.english: The thieves stole a purse containing bank-notes.
sentences.chinese: 小偷们偷到了一个里面有钞票的钱包。

sentences.english: The museum contains a number of original artworks.
sentences.chinese: 这家博物馆藏有一些原创艺术品。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as a bag, box, or place contains something, that thing is inside it

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: content
trans: n. 内容，满足；adj. 满足的

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

sentences.english: Our staff will be available to give you technical support .
sentences.chinese: 有我们的员工向你提供技术支持。

sentences.english: I have no technical knowledge at all.
sentences.chinese: 我一点技术知识都没有。

sentences.english: technical training
sentences.chinese: 技术培训

detailed_translations.english: connected with knowledge of how machines work

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

sentences.english: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
sentences.chinese: 这水温游泳正好。

sentences.english: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

sentences.english: The nurse took (= measured ) my temperature .
sentences.chinese: 护士给我量了体温。

detailed_translations.english: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: attempt
trans: v. 尝试，企图；n. 尝试

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

sentences.english: children with aggressive or anti-social tendencies
sentences.chinese: 具有攻击性倾向或反社会倾向的儿童

detailed_translations.chinese: 趋向， 趋势， 倾向
detailed_translations.english: if someone or something has a tendency to do or become a particular thing, they are likely to do or become it

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

sentences.english: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
sentences.chinese: 这种紧张变得难以忍受，我真想大声尖叫。

sentences.english: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

sentences.english: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
sentences.chinese: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

detailed_translations.english: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: contest
trans: n. 比赛，争论；v. 争夺

sentences.english: Stone decided to hold a contest to see who could write the best song.
sentences.chinese: 斯通决定举行一场比赛，看谁能够写出最佳歌曲。

sentences.english: I only entered the contest for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我只是为了好玩才参加这次比赛的。

sentences.english: It is clear that the election will be a close contest .
sentences.chinese: 显然这次选举将是一场难分高下的角逐。

sentences.english: the 1975 Liberal leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 1975年自由党的领导权之争

detailed_translations.english: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 争夺， 与…竞争； 对…提出质疑， 辩驳
detailed_translations.english: to say formally that you do not accept something or do not agree with it

sentences.english: an open-air theatre (= a theatre that is outside )
sentences.chinese: 露天剧场

sentences.english: the Mercury Theater
sentences.chinese: 水星剧院

detailed_translations.english: a building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed

sentences.english: Freudian theory has had a great influence on psychology.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

detailed_translations.english: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

sentences.english: ...his tolerance and understanding of diverse human nature.
sentences.chinese: …他对各种人性的宽容和理解。

detailed_translations.english: willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: track
trans: n. 轨道，小路；v. 跟踪

sentences.english: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

name: trace
trans: v. 追踪，查出；n. 痕迹

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: attractive
trans: adj. 有吸引力的，迷人的

sentences.english: an attractive young woman
sentences.chinese: 妩媚动人的年轻女子

sentences.english: Women seem to find him attractive .
sentences.chinese: 女性似乎觉得他很有吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有吸引力的， 引起注意的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is attractive is good looking, especially in a way that makes you sexually interested in them
