sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

sentences.english: the spread of nationalist sentiments
sentences.chinese: 民族主义情绪的传播

sentences.english: the anti-immigrant sentiments expressed by some Americans
sentences.chinese: 一些美国人表露出的反移民情绪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions

name: consent
trans: v. 同意，允许；n. 同意，许可

sentences.english: The chairman was elected by common consent (= with most people agreeing ) .
sentences.chinese: 主席是大家一致推选出来的。

sentences.english: divorce by mutual consent
sentences.chinese: 双方均同意的离婚

sentences.english: Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚事。

detailed_translations.english: agreement about something
to give your permission for something or agree to do something

sentences.english: The doctor will be here presently.
sentences.chinese: 医生一会儿就到。

sentences.english: Presently, I fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿我就睡着了。

sentences.english: The range of courses presently available has grown.
sentences.chinese: 目前可选择的课程范围已经扩大了。

detailed_translations.english: in a short time

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

sentences.english: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
sentences.chinese: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

detailed_translations.english: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

sentences.english: Many young girls became domestic servants .
sentences.chinese: 许多年轻姑娘成了家仆。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially in the past, who was paid to clean someone’s house, cook for them, answer the door etc, and who often lived in the house

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

sentences.english: a period of relative stability
sentences.chinese: 相对稳定的一段时期

detailed_translations.english: the condition of being steady and not changing

name: instant
trans: adj. 立即的，紧急的；n. 瞬间

sentences.english: an instant success
sentences.chinese: 马到成功

sentences.english: a system that provides instant access to client information
sentences.chinese: 能立即查到客户信息的系统

sentences.english: The women took an instant dislike to one another.
sentences.chinese: 这些女人立刻就彼此厌恶起来。

sentences.english: The programme brought an instant response.
sentences.chinese: 节目立即引起了反响。

sentences.english: For an instant, Barney was tempted to flee.
sentences.chinese: 那一瞬间，巴尼很想逃走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 立即的； 紧急的； 可以速食的
detailed_translations.english: happening or produced immediately
An instant is an extremely short period of time

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

sentences.english: Rebel gunmen have put up strong resistance.
sentences.chinese: 持枪的叛乱分子负隅顽抗。

sentences.english: disease resistance
sentences.chinese: 抗病能力

detailed_translations.english: fighting against someone who is attacking you

sentences.english: Some people are very resistant to the idea of exercise.
sentences.chinese: 一些人对锻炼的主意非常抵制。

detailed_translations.english: not damaged or affected by something

sentences.english: We offer financial assistance to students.
sentences.chinese: 我们向学生提供经济援助。

sentences.english: Can I be of any assistance (=  can I help you  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 我能帮什么忙吗？

detailed_translations.english: help or support

sentences.english: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果一直痛，你就必须去看医生了。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

name: substitute
trans: n. 替代品，代替者；v. 替代

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 社交的；好交际的；友善的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people

name: sole
trans: adj. 唯一的，单独的；n. 鞋底，脚底

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: solid
trans: adj. 固体的，坚固的；n. 固体

sentences.english: The lake was frozen solid .
sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.english: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
sentences.chinese: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。

sentences.english: Is the baby eating solid food (= bread, meat etc ) yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？

sentences.english: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
sentences.chinese: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

sentences.english: the properties of liquids and solids
sentences.chinese: 液体和固体的特性

detailed_translations.english: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: resort
trans: n. 度假胜地，手段；v. 求助，诉诸

sentences.english: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.english: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
sentences.chinese: 国会有责任确保在所有和平的手段用尽之后再诉诸武力。

detailed_translations.english: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available
The action of resorting to a course of action in a difficult situation

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

name: span
trans: n. 跨度，范围；v. 横跨

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

sentences.english: the Northern hemisphere
sentences.chinese: 北半球

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

name: spy
trans: n. 间谍，侦探；v. 监视

sentences.english: That day he spied on her while pretending to work on the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 那天他假装修剪灌木，却秘密地监视着她。

detailed_translations.english: If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.english: She gave him a suspicious glance.
sentences.chinese: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。

sentences.english: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
sentences.chinese: 你真是疑心太重！

detailed_translations.english: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: specify
trans: v. 具体说明，明确规定

sentences.english: Payments will be made for a specified number of months.
sentences.chinese: 款项将在规定的几个月内支付。

sentences.english: They specified a spacious entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 他们明确要求门厅要宽敞。

detailed_translations.english: to state something in an exact and detailed way

sentences.english: It is placed in the stern of a boat.
sentences.chinese: 它被放在船尾。

detailed_translations.english: the back of a ship
serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

name: constituent
trans: n. 组成部分，选民；adj. 构成的

sentences.english: the EU and its constituent members
sentences.chinese: 欧盟及其成员国

sentences.english: He told his constituents that he would continue to represent them to the best of his ability.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他的选民们他会继续竭尽所能代表他们。

detailed_translations.english: being one of the parts of something
someone who votes in a particular area

sentences.english: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute (= established by law ) .
sentences.chinese: 保障消费者权益已有法律明文规定。

detailed_translations.english: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

sentences.english: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

sentences.english: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: a ball of string
sentences.chinese: 一团细绳

sentences.english: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

sentences.english: a string of pearls
sentences.chinese: 一串珍珠

detailed_translations.english: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

sentences.english: (= I have been told ) to give the package to him personally.
sentences.chinese: 我接到的指示是亲手把包裹交给他。

sentences.english: Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要遵照医生的嘱咐。

sentences.english: The school gives instruction in first aid.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校教授急救课

detailed_translations.english: a statement telling someone what they must do

sentences.english: The authors summarize their views in the introduction.
sentences.chinese: 作者在序言里概述了他们的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short statement giving only the main information and not the details of a plan, event, report etc

name: superior
trans: adj. 优越的，上级的；n. 上司

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

sentences.english: the intellectual superiority of humans over other animals
sentences.chinese: 人类相比其他动物所具有的智力优势

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being better, more skilful, more powerful etc than other people or things

sentences.english: the cost of repairs and maintenance
sentences.chinese: 维修保养费

sentences.english: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
sentences.chinese: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。

sentences.english: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。

sentences.english: an evening class in car maintenance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保养的夜校课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
detailed_translations.english: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

sentences.english: continuous economic growth
sentences.chinese: 持续的经济增长

sentences.english: a continuous flow of information
sentences.chinese: 源源不断的信息

detailed_translations.english: continuing to happen or exist without stopping

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

name: temper
trans: n. 脾气，情绪；v. 缓和

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

name: contemporary
trans: adj. 当代的，同时代的；n. 同时代的人

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

sentences.english: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
sentences.chinese: 如果把贵重物品留在车上，会招来小偷的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

sentences.english: The house stands in extensive grounds.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.english: Fire has caused extensive damage to the island’s forests.
sentences.chinese: 大火严重毁坏了岛上的森林。

sentences.english: the extensive use of pesticides
sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂的大量使用

sentences.english: The exhibition has received extensive coverage in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览会被全国媒体广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: large in size, amount, or degree

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: protest
trans: v. 抗议，反对；n. 抗议

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

sentences.english: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要出口商品是纺织品，尤其是丝绸和棉布。

detailed_translations.english: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

sentences.english: Her tone was sharp with anger.
sentences.chinese: 她很气愤，语气尖刻。

sentences.english: It was obvious from her tone of voice that she didn’t like me.
sentences.chinese: 从她的语气明显听得出来她不喜欢我。

detailed_translations.english: the way your voice sounds, which shows how you are feeling or what you mean

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: trail
trans: n. 小径，踪迹；v. 追踪

sentences.english: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

name: retreat
trans: v. 撤退，退却；n. 撤退

sentences.english: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

detailed_translations.english: a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

name: extract
trans: v. 提取，摘录；n. 提取物

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

sentences.english: feminine intuition
sentences.chinese: 女性的直觉

sentences.english: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts

sentences.english: I had to have extra tuition in maths.
sentences.chinese: 我不得不上数学补习课。

detailed_translations.english: teaching, especially in small groups

sentences.english: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
sentences.chinese: 对不起打扰一下，我有个紧急消息。

sentences.english: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。

sentences.english: (= a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you ) .
sentences.chinese: 请勿打扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
detailed_translations.english: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

name: ultimate
trans: adj. 最终的，极限的；n. 极限

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

sentences.english: an abundant supply of fresh water
sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.english: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的
detailed_translations.english: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough

sentences.english: a London suburb
sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化；[生物] 变异，变种
detailed_translations.english: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

sentences.english: Ready meals sell well because of their convenience.
sentences.chinese: 即食餐因为方便销路好。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

name: venture
trans: n. 冒险，企业；v. 冒险

sentences.english: business/commercial venture
sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

sentences.english: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise (=  advertising brings good results  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告； 登广告
detailed_translations.english: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

sentences.english: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically

sentences.english: I was still in New York, trying to get a visa to visit Russia.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在纽约，正在办理去俄罗斯的签证。

detailed_translations.english: an official mark put on your passport that gives you permission to temporarily enter or leave a foreign country

sentences.english: Griffiths closely supervised the research.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

sentences.english: The wheel began to revolve.
sentences.chinese: 轮子开始旋转。

sentences.english: The restaurant slowly revolves, giving excellent views of the city.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅缓缓旋转，城市美景尽收眼底。

sentences.english: Using graphics software, you can revolve the image on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 使用绘图软件可以旋转屏幕上的图像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转；循环出现；反复考虑
detailed_translations.english: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

sentences.english: He decided to devote the rest of his life to scientific investigation.
sentences.chinese: 他决定把余生奉献给科学研究。

detailed_translations.english: to use all or most of your time, effort etc in order to do something or help someone

sentences.english: censorship of books
sentences.chinese: 书籍的审查

detailed_translations.english: the practice or system of censoring something

sentences.english: The house had lovely views over open countryside .
sentences.chinese: 这房子望出去是开阔的乡村美景。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农村，乡下；乡下的全体居民
detailed_translations.english: land that is outside cities and towns

name: deadline
trans: n. 截止日期，最后期限

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

sentences.english: What we are seeking, after all, is not simply an agreement to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻求的目标毕竟不只是一项限制温室气体排放的协议。

sentences.english: I think each and every one of us is responsible for the greenhouse gases we emit in our daily actions and choices.
sentences.chinese: 我认为每一个人都是我们每天的行动和选择中排放的温室气体的责任。

sentences.english: But presently it was set in a greenhouse, where the sunlight fell warm upon it, and water was sprinkled over it, and day by day as it waited, a change began to come to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是过了不久，黏土又给人放进了一间温室，这里阳光和煦地照射着它，并且经常给它喷水，这样就在它一天天静静等候的时候，某种变化终于开始到来。

detailed_translations.english: a glass building used for growing plants that need warmth, light, and protection

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

sentences.english: an economic policy that caused great hardship for many people
sentences.chinese: 造成许多人贫困的经济政策

sentences.english: Many students are suffering severe financial hardship.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生经济非常困难。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life

sentences.english: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

detailed_translations.chinese: 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
detailed_translations.english: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
detailed_translations.english: to give a headline to an article or story

sentences.english: Men are doing more housework nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 现今男人正在承担越来越多的家务。

detailed_translations.english: work that you do to take care of a house, for example washing, cleaning etc

sentences.english: The dispute culminated last week in a lawsuit against the government.
sentences.chinese: 这场针对政府诉讼案的争论在上星期达到了高潮。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

sentences.english: It’s the sort of opportunity you see only once in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 这种机会你一辈子也只能碰到一次。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which someone is alive or something exists

sentences.english: Since earliest times, mankind has been fascinated by fire.
sentences.chinese: 人类自远古以来就对火很感兴趣。

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重要的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: all humans considered as a group

name: membership
trans: n. 会员资格，成员身份

sentences.english: You should carry your membership card with you at all times.
sentences.chinese: 你应该随身携带会员卡。

sentences.english: Membership fees are being increased this year.
sentences.chinese: 会费今年提高了。

sentences.chinese: 赫尔穆特•科尔，德国前总理

sentences.chinese: 祝大家圣诞快乐、新年快乐！

sentences.english: the Norwegian national coach
sentences.chinese: 挪威国家队教练

detailed_translations.english: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

sentences.english: It’s a matter of common courtesy to acknowledge letters.
sentences.chinese: 确认收到来信是起码的礼貌。

sentences.english: The president paid a courtesy call on Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 总统礼节性地拜访了明仁天皇。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour and respect for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 殷勤的；被承认的；出于礼节的
detailed_translations.english: A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect

sentences.english: Try it. Don’t be such a coward.
sentences.chinese: 试一下，别那么胆小。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not at all brave

name: crack
trans: v. 破裂，打破；n. 裂缝

sentences.english: Don’t put boiling water in the glass or it will crack.
sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

sentences.english: Concrete is liable to crack in very cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 在严寒的天气条件下混凝土可能会开裂。

sentences.english: He picked up a piece of rock and cracked it in half.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一块石头，把它击碎成两半。

sentences.english: She fell and cracked a bone in her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔了一跤，结果一根腿骨骨折。

sentences.english: He cracked a couple of eggs into a pan.
sentences.chinese: 他往平底锅里打了几个鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: to break or to make something break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces
a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

sentences.english: A vast crowd gathered in the main square.
sentences.chinese: 主广场上聚集了一大群人。

sentences.english: She mingled with the crowd of guests, exchanging greetings.
sentences.chinese: 她穿梭在宾客中间和他们打招呼。

sentences.english: Saturday’s game was watched by a capacity crowd (= the maximum number of people that a sports ground etc can hold ) .
sentences.chinese: 星期六的比赛座无虚席。

sentences.english: Troops fired tear gas and shots to disperse a crowd of 15,000 demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 军队发射催泪弹并开枪来驱散15,000名示威群众。

sentences.english: I didn’t know him; he wasn’t one of the usual crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我不认识他，他不是平时那一群人里的。

sentences.english: He wanted to go unnoticed, to be one of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他想默默无闻地做个普通人。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

sentences.english: His death was a cruel blow .
sentences.chinese: 他的死是个无情的打击。

sentences.english: Sometimes life seems unbearably cruel.
sentences.chinese: 有时候生活残酷得让人无法承受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的
detailed_translations.english: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

sentences.english: I like to eat cucumber sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢吃有黄瓜的三明治。

sentences.english: Have some cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 吃点黄瓜吧。

sentences.english: The "gurkophone" is one of their classics, made from a hollowed cucumber , a pepper and a carrot.
sentences.chinese: 黄瓜管“是他们的经典乐器之一，那是用掏空的黄瓜、辣椒和胡萝卜做的。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin round vegetable with a dark green skin and a light green inside, usually eaten raw

sentences.english: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.chinese: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

detailed_translations.english: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

sentences.english: He wanted to ask her, but he didn’t dare.
sentences.chinese: 他想问她，但又不敢。

sentences.english: ‘I’ll tell Dad.’ ‘You wouldn’t dare!’
sentences.chinese: “我要告诉爸爸。” “谅你也不敢！”

sentences.english: How dare you accuse me of lying!
sentences.chinese: 你竟敢说我撒谎！

detailed_translations.english: to be brave enough to do something that is risky or that you are afraid to do – used especially in questions or negative sentences

sentences.english: the admissions dean
sentences.chinese: 招生主任

detailed_translations.english: someone in a university who is responsible for a particular area of work

name: decay
trans: v. 腐烂，衰退；n. 腐烂

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

sentences.english: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。

sentences.english: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
sentences.chinese: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

detailed_translations.english: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc

sentences.english: French and German were deemed essential.
sentences.chinese: 法语和德语被认为是必需的。

detailed_translations.english: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

sentences.english: a diligent student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 勤勉的；用功的，费尽心血的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is diligent works hard and is careful and thorough

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

sentences.english: Why do you dislike her so much?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么那么讨厌她？

sentences.english: My dislike of thunder and even small earthquakes was due to Mother.
sentences.chinese: 我对雷声甚至于轻微地震的厌恶都归因于我的母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
Dislike is the feeling that you do not like someone or something

name: doom
trans: n. 厄运，劫数；v. 注定，判定

sentences.english: A sense of impending doom (= coming very soon ) gripped her.
sentences.chinese: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

sentences.english: The plan was doomed from the start.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

detailed_translations.english: something very bad that is going to happen, or the fact that it is going to happen
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

sentences.english: the great traditions of ancient Greek drama
sentences.chinese: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

sentences.english: a new drama series for Saturday nights
sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.english: a courtroom drama
sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.english: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

sentences.english: He’s a bright kid and eager to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他是个聪明的孩子，热爱学习。

sentences.english: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
sentences.chinese: 她工作很卖力，而且很希望别人满意。

sentences.english: A crowd of eager young students were already waiting outside.
sentences.chinese: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

detailed_translations.english: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

sentences.english: Put the eggs in the centre of the dish, with the vegetables and herbs around the edge.
sentences.chinese: 把鸡蛋放在盘子中间，盘边一圈放些蔬菜和香草。

sentences.english: He stood at the water’s edge staring across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 他站在水边，凝视着湖对面。

sentences.english: A leaf was on the ground, curling up at the edges.
sentences.chinese: 地上有一片叶子，叶边卷曲着。

sentences.english: a knife with a sharp edge
sentences.chinese: 刀刃锋利的小刀

detailed_translations.english: the part of an object that is furthest from its centre

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

sentences.english: The bridge is a triumph of modern engineering.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥是现代工程的一大成就。

sentences.english: a degree in engineering
sentences.chinese: 工程学学位

detailed_translations.english: the activity of applying scientific knowledge to the design, building and control of machines, roads, bridges, electrical equipment, etc.

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

sentences.english: They try to equip their vehicles with gadgets to deal with every possible contingency.
sentences.chinese: 他们尽量给他们的车辆配备各种小装置以应付任何可能的突发状况。

detailed_translations.english: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

sentences.english: We were both new to the excitements of life in the big city.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都是初次感受大城市多姿多彩的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激， 激动， 兴奋； 令人兴奋的事， 刺激的因素
detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being excited

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: fake
trans: adj. 假的，伪造的；n. 赝品

sentences.english: fake fur
sentences.chinese: 人造毛皮

sentences.english: a fake ID card
sentences.chinese: 假身份证

sentences.english: a fake 20 dollar bill
sentences.chinese: 一张20美元的伪钞

detailed_translations.english: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people
a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people

detailed_translations.chinese: 伪造， 捏造； 伪装
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem real in order to deceive people

sentences.english: You look fantastic!
sentences.chinese: 你看上去棒极了！

sentences.english: It’s a fantastic place, really beautiful!
sentences.chinese: 这真是个好地方，漂亮极了！

detailed_translations.chinese: 极好的， 极出色的， 了不起的； 极大的； 难以相信的； 异想天开的， 不实际的； 奇异的， 古怪的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good, attractive, enjoyable etc

sentences.english: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 保罗人很随和。

detailed_translations.english: a man

sentences.english: Sylvia fetched a towel from the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅从浴室拿来一条毛巾。

sentences.english: Fetch me a glass of water.
sentences.chinese: 给我拿杯水来。

detailed_translations.english: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are

name: flash
trans: v. 闪光，闪现；n. 闪光

sentences.english: Two flashes mean danger.
sentences.chinese: 两次闪光表示危险。

sentences.english: Lightning flashed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 头顶上电光闪闪。

detailed_translations.english: a bright light that shines for a short time and then stops shining
to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: foster
trans: v. 培养，促进；adj. 收养的

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: frame
trans: n. 框架，结构；v. 构造

sentences.english: Newman played a central role in framing the new law.
sentences.chinese: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

sentences.english: To be perfectly frank, I think it’s a bad idea.
sentences.chinese: 老实说，我认为这个主意不好。

detailed_translations.english: honest and truthful

sentences.english: The metal glowed in the furnace.
sentences.chinese: 金属在熔炉里发出灼热的光。

sentences.english: An adjustable plate, as in the flue of a furnace or stove, for controlling the draft.
sentences.chinese: 挡板，调节风门一种可调节的薄片，如在熔炉或火炉的通气管中的，用来控制气流。

sentences.english: The graceful preface was laced by a commonplace maid near the furnace in the palace without any trace of embrace.
sentences.chinese: 这份优雅的前言是由一个平凡的侍女在宫殿里的火炉边，不留住拥抱过的痕迹而系上带子的。

detailed_translations.english: a large container for a very hot fire, used to produce power, heat, or liquid metal

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.english: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备，布置 （房间、建筑物）；供应，提供
detailed_translations.english: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

name: gaze
trans: v. 凝视，注视；n. 凝视

sentences.english: Patrick sat gazing into space  (= looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing ).
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克坐着，茫然地看着前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so
a long steady look

sentences.english: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: “他真的这样？”她好像是真的惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

name: glance
trans: v. 瞥见，扫视；n. 一瞥

sentences.english: Wyatt glanced around the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。

sentences.english: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼，笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to quickly look at someone or something
a quick look

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

name: grin
trans: v. 露齿笑；n. 露齿笑

sentences.english: He grins, delighted at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 想起往事，他咧嘴笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to smile widely
a wide smile

sentences.english: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
sentences.chinese: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

detailed_translations.english: help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

name: hail
trans: v. 歌颂，致敬；n. 冰雹

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

sentences.english: I think he’s harbouring some sort of grudge against me.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他对我有点怀恨在心。

sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽和沥水板可能藏有病菌。

sentences.chinese: 匈牙利前领导人被指控窝藏疑犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀着（不好的想法、恐惧或希望）；包含，藏有；窝藏
detailed_translations.english: to keep bad thoughts, fears, or hopes in your mind for a long time

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: harvest
trans: n. 收获，成果；v. 收割

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

sentences.english: He believed that he and his wife would one day be together again in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他和妻子有一天会在天国重聚。

sentences.english: He looked up towards the heavens.
sentences.chinese: 他仰望苍穹。

detailed_translations.english: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

sentences.chinese: 剑劈开了骑士的头盔并致命地刺进他。

sentences.english: Instead, he was told the last time that she loved him, got a hug from her, put his helmet on her so that she can live, and die himself...
sentences.chinese: 相反，他叫女孩最后一次说她爱他，最后一次拥抱他，并让她戴上自己的头盔，因而，女孩可以幸免于难，而他自己却离开了人世……

sentences.english: Without Christ we are defenseless against the Devil, but with "the helmet of salvation" our minds are protected by God.
sentences.chinese: 没有基督，我们无力防御魔鬼的攻击；但有救恩的头盔，我们的心思便有神的保护。

detailed_translations.english: a strong hard hat that soldiers,  motorcycle  riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads

sentences.english: a heroin addict
sentences.chinese: 海洛因瘾君子

detailed_translations.english: a powerful and illegal drug made from  morphine

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

name: hint
trans: n. 暗示，提示；v. 暗示

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

sentences.english: a species of fish hitherto unknown in the West
sentences.chinese: 迄今在西方还不为人知的一种鱼

detailed_translations.english: up to this time

sentences.english: the 800 m world record holder
sentences.chinese: 800米世界纪录保持者

sentences.english: Season-ticket holders are furious at the rise in rail fares.
sentences.chinese: 买季票的人对火车票价上涨极为愤怒。

sentences.english: British passport holders
sentences.chinese: 英国护照持有人

detailed_translations.chinese: 持有人；所有人；固定器；（台、架等）支持物
detailed_translations.english: someone who owns or controls something

sentences.english: She had all the normal childhood illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 儿童的常见病她小时候都得过。

sentences.english: Her mother was recovering from a serious illness.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲重病后正在逐渐康复。

sentences.english: I’ve never missed a day’s work through illness.
sentences.chinese: 我从未因病耽误过一天工作。

sentences.english: ways to improve your health and reduce the risk of illness
sentences.chinese: 增进健康减少疾病的方法

detailed_translations.english: a disease of the body or mind, or the condition of being ill

name: incidentally
trans: adv. 顺便提一句，附带地

sentences.english: Incidentally, where were you born?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，你在哪儿出生的？

sentences.english: The wine, incidentally, goes very well with a mature cheese.
sentences.chinese: 顺便说一下，这种葡萄酒配熟干酪味道很好。

detailed_translations.english: used to add more information to what you have just said, or to introduce a new subject that you have just thought of

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

name: initiate
trans: v. 开始，发起；n. 创始者

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

sentences.english: She climbed up the ladder.
sentences.chinese: 她爬上梯子。

sentences.english: He hurt himself falling off a ladder.
sentences.chinese: 他从梯子上摔下来受了伤。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for climbing up to or down from high places. A ladder has two bars that are connected by rungs(= short bars that you use as steps ) .

sentences.english: a quiet country lane
sentences.chinese: 一条宁静的乡间小路

sentences.english: ...after being disqualified for running out of his lane in the 200 metres.
sentences.chinese: …在200米比赛中由于冲出跑道而被取消比赛资格以后。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow road in the countryside

sentences.english: laser surgery
sentences.chinese: 激光(外科)手术

detailed_translations.english: a beam of light produced by a laser

sentences.english: He pulled off layer upon layer of clothing (= many layers of clothing ).
sentences.chinese: 他把衣服一件件地脱掉。

detailed_translations.english: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

sentences.english: She turned away from the window lest anyone see them.
sentences.chinese: 她转身离开窗边，免得有人看见他们。

sentences.english: He paused, afraid lest he say too much.
sentences.chinese: 他停顿下来，唯恐说得太多。

detailed_translations.english: in order to make sure that something will not happen

sentences.english: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.
sentences.chinese: 她将可以伸开蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

sentences.english: She sat on a limb of the tree and looked down.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：她坐在一根大树枝上往下看.

detailed_translations.english: an arm or leg

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

name: loom
trans: v. 隐约出现，迫近；n. 织布机

sentences.english: Vincent loomed over me, as pale and grey as a tombstone.
sentences.chinese: 文森特赫然出现在我面前，脸色苍白阴沉得像块墓碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 织布机；若隐若现的景象
detailed_translations.english: a frame or machine on which thread is woven into cloth

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕地出现；朦胧地出现；隐约可见
detailed_translations.english: to appear as a large unclear shape, especially in a threatening way

sentences.chinese: 球队的忠实支持者

sentences.english: her many years of loyal service to the company
sentences.chinese: 她在公司多年的忠诚服务

sentences.english: loyal customers
sentences.chinese: 忠实客户

detailed_translations.english: always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

sentences.english: They searched his luggage for illegal drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他们搜查他的行李看是否藏有毒品。

detailed_translations.english: the cases, bags etc that you carry when you are travelling

trans: v. 引诱，诱惑；n. 诱饵，吸引力

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

sentences.english: ...a professor of mathematics at Boston College.
sentences.chinese: …一位波士顿大学的数学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the science of numbers and of shapes, including  algebra  ,  geometry  , and  arithmetic

sentences.english: mathematical analysis
sentences.chinese: 数学分析

sentences.english: the development of mathematical skills
sentences.chinese: 数学技能的发展

sentences.english: a mathematical genius
sentences.chinese: 数学天才

detailed_translations.english: relating to or using mathematics

sentences.english: the election of the London mayor
sentences.chinese: 选举伦敦市长

detailed_translations.english: the person who has been elected to lead the government of a town or city

sentences.chinese: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。

sentences.english: The two boys were awarded medals for their bravery.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩因勇敢而获得勋章。

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

name: medium
trans: n. 媒介，手段；adj. 中等的

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

sentences.english: It was warmer now, and the snow was beginning to melt.
sentences.chinese: 现在天气暖和了，雪开始融化。

sentences.english: Melt the butter in a saucepan.
sentences.chinese: 把黄油放在深平底锅里化开。

detailed_translations.english: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

sentences.english: The gate is made of metal.
sentences.chinese: 这扇大门是用金属做成的。

sentences.english: a small black metal box
sentences.chinese: 一个黑色的金属小盒子

sentences.english: They traded in gold and other precious metals (= valuable metals used especially for making jewellery ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们做黄金和其他贵金属的交易。

sentences.english: The old trucks were sold as scrap metal (= old metal that is melted and used again ) .
sentences.chinese: 这些旧卡车被当作金属废料卖掉了。

sentences.chinese: 他的声音轻柔温和。

sentences.chinese: 药力温和的除草剂

sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

name: minor
trans: adj. 较小的，次要的；n. 未成年人

sentences.english: We have made some minor changes to the program.
sentences.chinese: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。

sentences.english: a relatively minor error
sentences.chinese: 相对较小的错误

sentences.english: a minor road
sentences.chinese: 小路

sentences.english: They played only a minor role in local government.
sentences.chinese: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

detailed_translations.english: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

name: mock
trans: v. 嘲笑，模仿；adj. 假的

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

sentences.english: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

sentences.english: the government’s tight monetary policy
sentences.chinese: 政府从紧的货币政策

sentences.english: objects of little monetary value
sentences.chinese: 不值钱的物件

detailed_translations.english: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country
